name: Natural: Avoid Programs with High Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Avoid Artifacts with High Cyclomatic Complexity (CC greater than X). The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will. The specific Natural statement counted are IF, DECIDE, WHEN, VALUE, PEFORM and FOR
rationale:
Cyclomatic Complexity is a measure of the complexity of the control structure of an Artifact. It is the number of linearly independent paths and therefore, the minimum number of independent paths when executing the software. The effort and time for diagnosis of deficiencies or causes of failures, or for identification of parts to be modified is directly related to the number of execution paths, i.e. the complexity of the control flow. 
Analyzability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity. 
Each modification must be correct for all execution paths. Cyclomatic Complexity computes the number of the linearly independent paths, a lower bound of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations.
remediation: Reduce the number of decision points included in the artifact.

technicalCriteria.name: Complexity - Algorithmic and Control Structure Complexity
